intro: Polycarpaea eriantha var. effusa, commonly known as the hairy polycarpaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. It is native to parts of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
